result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary M Langlois

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Defendant in court in custody with attorney Renner. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Guilty plea count #1 & #2. PSI ordered. Discussion regard sentencing on 1 counts but can't be sentenced to both. Case needs to be re-assigned and sentencing date set with new Judge. Minutes filed.

8:32 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gary M Langlois appeared by video.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Gary M Langlois. 
Atty Renner asks for a time next week. 
Plea hearing set for June 30, 2022 @ 1:15pm, 2464

Defendant Gary M Langlois in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Gary M Langlois. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Gary M Langlois in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Gary M Langlois. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
2:03 PM Defendant Gary M Langlois appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann in court.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Gary M Langlois. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
State is waiting on blood results.

Adj. 2:06PM

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gary M Langlois in court, in custody by video. Attorney Leah Selmek appeared for Attorney Tony Kim in court for Gary M Langlois. Reading of complaint waived; charges/penalties explained by the court. Need complaint, ADA Crawford stated complaint was provided to Attorney Kim. Court advises defendant of charges. Rights given and hearing requested, within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gary M Langlois in court, in custody by video. Attorney Tony Kim appeared. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Kim. Argument, motion denied, bond remains. Defendant given complaint. Court has reviewed criminal complaint.  Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

MUST POST 2,500 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-1429
Signed bond filed with the court.
